intro: Uapaca densifolia var. sambiranensis, commonly known as the Sambira mabele, is a shrub or small tree native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its dense, dark green foliage and small, white flowers. The plant produces edible berries that are often used in traditional medicine and local cuisines. It thrives in humid, well-drained soils and is typically found in forested areas. Its botanical features make it an important species in both ecological and cultural contexts.
